thread.title: Mets CF Cespedes leaves NLCS with left shoulder soreness
thread.title_full: Mets CF Cespedes leaves NLCS with left shoulder soreness

title: Mets CF Cespedes leaves NLCS with left shoulder soreness
text:
Mets CF Yoenis Cespedes pulled from Game 4 of NLCS with left shoulder tightness THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   9:34   9:34   
People: 
New York (1742) 

CHICAGO — Mets center fielder Yoenis Cespedes has left Game 4 of the NL Championship Series due to soreness in his left shoulder. 
Cespedes walked and scored on Lucas Duda's three-run homer in the first inning on Wednesday night. He struck out looking in the second and was replaced by Juan Lagares before the bottom half of the inning. 
New York was trying for a sweep of the series. 
Cespedes was acquired in a July 31 trade with Detroit and helped power the Mets to the NL East title. He was batting .273 with two homers and seven RBIs in the playoffs coming into the night.
